page.title: 19TRIPE DRESSERS, PADIHAM
page.content: The tripe works has been established for 95 years and processes up to 1000 cows' stomachs per week. {Processes:} 1 Soaking in chemicals to kill bacteria. 2 Steam heating to kill remaining bacteria. 3 Spin drying to remove fat. 4 Cooking for 3 hours. 5 Cooling and soaking in dilute hydrogen peroxide. 6 Thorough rinsing. 7 Cutting and final cleaning, by hand. 8 Packing in trays. The works also processes cows' udders to make elder, pigs' feet to make trotters and cows' feet to make cow-heel. Bones and fat are sent to soap factories. These fine products are enjoyed throughout Lancashire.
